Rat Trap could see Tucson below, as he's being towed by his comrades. He lo=
oks up to Windlord pleadingly, wanting to be set down on Tucson's trailer i=
f possible.

" Could ya set me down on Wheel's trailer?  I gotta see how he=
's don'.  Poor bot, he really took a gamble out there for us."

Down on the=
 ground, Tucson sighs.  His condition was not the best, yet he tries hard t=
o fend off the worst of its affects.

" I've been through - worse Talon.  I=
'm all right.  My - only regret, is that - I - did not think things through=
 as I - should have.  I - completely ignorred Master - Yokitron's training,=
 which - would have been - more effective in - this case, rather - than bru=
te force.  All - of you went - above and - beyond the - call of duty, and I=
 - can - never repay you - for your outstanding dedication to our - cause. =
 I - have to learn - not to let my - temper get - the better - of me.  Toda=
y - is such an example."

As they head home, Tucson gradually reveals more =
and more of himself to his comrades, which was definitely an infinite show =
of trust.

" Before the power - of the Matrix, I - was known to be - a bit =
more aggressive than - most Autobots.  Talon, you know- you - saw that firs=
t hand when - we encountered that Minion in that abandoned base.  I - locke=
d myself in with the enemy, and did - not stop until I had him restrained. =
 That - too was one of my mistakes, I - was lucky it turned out for the bes=
t."

He sighs once more.  Battery fluid continues to leak from his injury.
=

up to Kup as he works beside him.

ciate everyone's help.  But - please, do - not strain
